me.sudofu.smartionary
[Groovy] Class Smartionary

java.lang.Object
  me.sudofu.smartionary.Smartionary

class Smartionary

The primary progremmatic interface for Smartionary.

Smartionary provides a flexible and progremmatic interface for storing information in a Grails Domain that mimics the structure of a single-level Map.

Instantiating the Domain information can be done directly via a Map, and/or updated individually. For example: 

 Smartionary.set(
     'mySmartionary',
     'This is a sample Smartionary instantiation.',
     myFirstElement: 'foo',
     mySecondElement: 2,
     myThirdElement: new Date(),
     smartionaryDescriptions: [
         _entryDescriptions: "Here is where you can put entry descriptions., but this one will be ignored since there is no key above that matches it."
         myFirstElement: "My first element."
         myThirdElement: "This will get converted to a human-readable timestamp, as all elements are converted to a String."
     ]
 )
The Smartionary can then retrieve the Domain as a Map later like so: 
 Map myElements = Smartionary.get('mySmartionary')

 println myElements.myFirstElement

Note that the Domains are instantiated dynamically. That is, foo would have been daynamically created with that call if it did not previously exist, and the key-value pairs associated to it. A subsequent call of that form would update any entries that are already associated with what were passed, and create new ones that were given.

Descriptions can be omitted or included as desired. The Smartionary does not interface with retrieving descriptions, as that meant more for when observing the views (i.e. administratively). In the set method, the smartionaryDescriptions is a "reserved" keyword for telling the method to use entries in that key that have the same key as the outer level to include as descriptions. It ignores any keys that are not present when the method is passed; this is to prevent trying to update descriptions of entries that do not exist, and makes it clear that the value null cannot be implicitly set to an entry just by updating its description.

Also provided are ways of interacting with JSON as reasonably easily as possible.

Authors:
Aaron Brown

Method Detail

_set

private static void _set(SmartionaryDomain domain, java.lang.String key, java.lang.Object value, java.lang.String description = null)
Set an individual SmartionaryEntry.value in a Smartionary, or create it if it does not exist.

Note: All datatypes are converted to String via the toString() method; therefore, new Date() would result in java.util.Date#toString() date, whereas new Date().getTime() would result in java.lang.Long#toString() date.

Parameters:
domain - The Smartionary object to act on.
key - The SmartionaryEntry.key identifier to set the value of (created if it does not exist).
value - The SmartionaryEntry.value to set.
desription - An optional description to set with the object.

contains

static boolean contains(java.lang.String smartionaryName, java.lang.Object value)
Check if the Smartionary contains a SmartionaryEntry by a given value.
Parameters:
smartionaryName - The name of the Smartionary to check.
value - The SmartionaryEntry.value to check for (converted to String).
Returns:
true if and only if the Smartionary exists, and it is associated with a SmartionaryEntry in which the value field matches that which was passed.

static boolean containsKey(java.lang.String smartionaryName, java.lang.String key)
Check if the Smartionary contains a SmartionaryEntry by a given key.
Parameters:
smartionaryName - The name of the Smartionary to check.
key - The SmartionaryEntry.key to check for.
Returns:
true if and only if the Smartionary exists, and it is associated with a SmartionaryEntry in which the key field matches that which was passed.

delete

static void delete(java.lang.String smartionaryName)
Delete a Smartionary (and its SmartionaryEntries).

No impact if called on a non-existant Smartionary.

Parameters:
smartionaryName - The Name of the Smartionary Object to delete; will also delete the SmartionaryEntry Objects associated with it.

delete

static void delete(java.lang.String smartionaryName, java.lang.String key)
Delete an SmartionaryEntry from a Smartionary.

No impact if called on a non-existant Smartionary, or if the key is not associated to an existing one.

Parameters:
smartionaryName - The Smartionary to act upon.
key - The SmartionaryEntry.key of the SmartionaryEntry Object to delete.

delete

static void delete(java.lang.String smartionaryName, java.lang.String... keys)
Delete an series of SmartionaryEntry objects from a Smartionary.

No impact if called on a non-existant Smartionary, or if the key is not associated to an existing one.

Parameters:
smartionaryName - The Smartionary to act upon.
keys - The SmartionaryEntry.key of the SmartionaryEntry Objects to delete.

fromJson

static void fromJson(java.lang.String smartionaryName, java.lang.String json, java.lang.String smartionaryDescription = null)
Set a Smartionary with (or without) SmartionaryEntries.

Sample call 

 String json = '{"a": "apple", "b": "banana", "c": "carrot"}'

 Smartionary.set('foo', json, 'Using JSON')

Note: All datatypes are converted to String via the toString() method; therefore, new Date() would result in java.util.Date#toString() date, whereas new Date().getTime() would result in java.lang.Long#toString() date.

throws:
IllegalArgumentException Thrown if any of the keys in the entries Map are not instances of String, or if any of the descriptions in the entries.smartionaryDescriptions field are not instances of String; also inherited from groovy.json.JsonSlurper.
Parameters:
smartionaryName -

The Smartionary.name of an existing Smartionary Object; or, if no Smartionary exists by that name, it will be created.

json - This JSON Map will correspond to SmartionaryEntry Objects. The keys will correspond to SmartionaryEntry.key and the values will correspond to SmartionaryEntry.value. Therefore, keys that do not exist will be created, and keys that already exist will be updated (just like a regular Map); Note that the keys and values will be converted to java.lang.String.
smartionaryDesription - An optional description to set with the object.

get

static java.util.Map get(java.lang.String smartionaryName)
Retrieve a Smartionary domain and convert all of its SmartionaryEntries into a Map.
Parameters:
smartionaryName - The name of the Smartionary to get.
Returns:
null if the smartionaryName does not correspond to a Smartionary domain Object; or a Map<String, String>, with the keys corresponding to SmartionaryEntry.key and the values corresponding to SmartionaryEntry.value. The values are Strings, so it may be necessary to convert these values to other built-in datatypes (i.e. Integer) as desired / necessary.

get

static java.lang.String get(java.lang.String smartionaryName, java.lang.String key)
Retrieve a specific SmartionaryEntry.value from a Smartionary.
Parameters:
smartionaryName - The name of the Smartionary to retrieve the value from.
key - The SmartionaryEntry.key identifier to retrieve the value of.
Returns:
The appropriate value for the given key in the Smartionary datastructure; or null.

getAsJson

static java.lang.String getAsJson(java.lang.String smartionaryName, boolean pretty = false)
Retrieve a Smartionary as JSON.
Parameters:
smartionaryName - The name of the Smartionary to retrieve as JSON.
pretty - Optionally specify whether or not to return pretty-formatted JSON through groovy.json.JsonBuilder#toPrettyString().
Returns:
{"a":"apple","b":"banana","c","carrot"}

No impact if the Smartionary does not exist.

Parameters:
smartionaryName - The Name of the Smartionary to act on.

purgeNulls

static void purgeNulls(java.lang.String smartionaryName)
Delete any SmartionaryEntry objects associated to a Smartionary that have null values.

No impact if the Smartionary does not exist, or if none of its SmartionaryEntry objects have null values.

Parameters:
smartionaryName - The Name of the Smartionary to act on.

Set a Smartionary without interfering with or creating any entries.

smartionaryName - The Smartionary.name of an existing Smartionary Object; or, if no Smartionary exists by that name, it will be created.
smartionaryDesription - An optional description to set with the object.

set

static void set(java.util.Map entries, java.lang.String smartionaryName, java.lang.String smartionaryDescription = null)
Set a Smartionary with (or without) SmartionaryEntries.

Sample call (using groovy Named parameters): 

 Smartionary.set(
     'foo',
     'A sample use of Smartionary.set()',
     warGames: 'tic-tac-toe',
     ten: 4,
     x: new Date(),
     y: UUID.randomUUID(),
     smartionaryDescriptions: [
          warGames: 'A strange game. The only winning move is not to play.",
          ten: 'A common expression in radio communication.',
          x: 'Right now.'
     ]
 )

Note: All datatypes are converted to String via the toString() method; therefore, new Date() would result in java.util.Date#toString() date, whereas new Date().getTime() would result in java.lang.Long#toString() date.

throws:
IllegalArgumentException Thrown if any of the keys in the entries Map are not instances of String, or if any of the descriptions in the entries.smartionaryDescriptions field are not instances of String.
Parameters:
entries - This Map will correspond to SmartionaryEntry Objects. The keys will correspond to SmartionaryEntry.key and the values will correspond to SmartionaryEntry.value. Therefore, keys that do not exist will be created, and keys that already exist will be updated (just like a regular Map); Note that the keys and values will be converted to java.lang.String.
smartionaryName - The Smartionary.name of an existing Smartionary Object; or, if no Smartionary exists by that name, it will be created.
smartionaryDesription - An optional description to set with the object.

set

static void set(java.lang.String smartionaryName, java.lang.String key, java.lang.Object value, java.lang.String entryDescription = null, java.lang.String smartionaryDescription = null)
Set an individual SmartionaryEntry.value in a Smartionary, or create it if it does not exist.

Note: All datatypes are converted to String via the toString() method; therefore, new Date() would result in java.util.Date#toString() date, whereas new Date().getTime() would result in java.lang.Long#toString() date.

Parameters:
smartionaryName - The Smartionary.name of an existing Smartionary Object; or, if no Smartionary exists by that name, it will be created.
key - The SmartionaryEntry.key identifier to set the value of (created if it does not exist).
value - The SmartionaryEntry.value to set.
entryDesription - An optional description to set with the object.
smartionaryDesription - An optional description to set with the object.

size

static int size(java.lang.String smartionaryName)
Retrieve the number of SmartionaryEntry objects are associated with a Smartionary.
Parameters:
smartionaryName - The name of the Smartionary to check.
Returns:
The number of entries associated to the Smartionary, or 0 if the entries field is null, or -1 if the Smartionary does not exist.
